Summary Energetic IT leader with a record of achievement in delivering smooth operations, productivity, and cost savings through excellence in management of high-profile IT infrastructure. Extensive expertise in Microsoft and VMware technologies Summary Energetic IT leader with a record of achievement in delivering smooth operations, productivity, and cost savings through excellence in management of high-profile IT infrastructure. Extensive expertise in Microsoft and VMware technologies Energetic IT leader with a record of achievement in delivering smooth operations, productivity, and cost savings through excellence in management of high-profile IT infrastructure. Extensive expertise in Microsoft and VMware technologies Energetic IT leader with a record of achievement in delivering smooth operations, productivity, and cost savings through excellence in management of high-profile IT infrastructure. Extensive expertise in Microsoft and VMware technologies Experience Sr. IT Engineer Intel Corporation November 2010  – Present (4 years 10 months) Dallas/Fort Worth Area Played a leading role in a 24/7 IT operations team monitoring the enterprise (servers, network, and applications). Supported Windows/Linux Servers (virtual machine/physical) across 8 datacenters worldwide and 50+ remote offices. Configured backups for servers, and troubleshot backup failures. Provided training, authored documentation/run books for the Global Operations Center (GOC) team, and liaised between the GOC and the infrastructure services team. Leveraged Remedy ticketing for working incidents, requests, tasks, and work orders. Monitored with HP tools, and responded to alerts. 
 
Highlights 
•	Served instrumentally in building the 24/7 team from the ground up to monitor and support infrastructure; developed documentation on how to remediate situations. 
•	Improved client satisfaction by advancing performance and service. 
o	Cut monitoring alerts noise/false alarms by 90% and improved productivity by gathering information from clients and adjusting monitoring thresholds based on client perceptions. 
o	Achieved all targets for acknowledging/closing out incidents/work orders and resolving backup failures for servers, including SOX-classified servers; attained 99.9% uptime on servers and applications and 99% successful backups. 
o	Boosted efficiency of the self-service portal by collaborating with the IT Service Management Team to facilitate building forms. 
 Enterprise Client Services Manager McAfee (Aquired by Intel) July 2010  –  December 2010  (6 months) Plano, TX Led a global team of technical experts. Orchestrated mobile device management and global client systems patch management, desktop client management, and client security management (firewall, anti-virus, intrusion prevention, group policy, end point encryption). 
 
Highlights 
•	Successfully launched the mobile email solution McAfee EMM to internal McAfee globally. 
•	Increased efficiency and cut troubleshooting time with a process progressively deploying new product releases on small internal groups until released throughout the organization. 
•	Achieved 99% security compliance with current end-point virus definition (DAT files) and Windows security updates. 
 IT Operations Tier 2 Site Supervisor McAfee December 2001  –  July 2010  (8 years 8 months) Dallas/Fort Worth Area Led a team of four engineers in supporting1000+ users at the Plano facility, headquarters to Legal, Human Resources, Finance, Sales, IT, Engineering, and Technical Support. Oversaw a team delivering second-level desktop support on escalated issues/requests. Provided 24/7 direct support to McAfee Vice Presidents with laptops/smartphones. Supported print devices and servers. Traveled internationally to provide IT and AV support for meetings and conferences. Collaborated with a team upgrading Windows for 5000+ end users, and relocated the McAfee office and datacenter from Dallas to Plano. 
 
Highlights 
•	Reduced the number of incidents and improved response time by applying the problem management process and training the team on frequent issues. 
•	Created a successful premium support team for company VIPs, setting up a hotline number with a process to accelerate response time. 
•	Saved on costs by migrating printers from HP to Xerox and users from RSA VPN hard tokens to RSA VPN soft tokens. 
•	Played a critical role in integrating acquired companies into the McAfee infrastructure as part of the Mergers and Acquisitions (M&A) team. 
 IT System Administrator DNA Sciences, Inc. April 2000  –  October 2001  (1 year 7 months) San Francisco Bay Area -Responsible for all Windows servers and services running (Active Directory, DNS, DHCP, Exchange, and File servers).  
-Perform backups and restores utilizing Veritas Backup Exec.  
-Delivered desktop support for the office, which accounted for about 100 users.  
-Created and maintained computer images for rapid deployment on PC’s. I documented hardware/software standards for the company 
 
accomplished major projects successfully:  
-Upgraded entire office from Windows NT 4.0 workstation to Windows 2000 Professional -Relocated our office and data center from the Mountain View, CA to Fremont, CA location -Migrated acquired company into DNA Sciences network environment -Decommissioned Novell network, and migrated to a Microsoft network infrastructure. IT Operations Tier 2 Desktop Support McAfee March 1997  –  April 2000  (3 years 2 months) San Francisco Bay Area -I worked with a team that provided 2nd level desktop support for the McAfee office in Santa Clara, CA. Santa Clara office was McAfee headquarters, and occupied more than 1000 employees.  
-Worked a variety of desktop issues/requests for end users in the building, and remotely. Supported all print devices, and print servers. Utilized helpdesk ticketing system to track incidents and work orders.
